snippet: While the rest of Spain’s economy struggles, prostitution — almost all of it involving the ruthless trafficking of foreign women — is exploding into public view.
abstract: Spanish authorities are attempting to combat a boom in the prostitution trade, which has been fueled by an influx of abused and trafficked women, lax regulation and increasing demand from young European tourists who travel to the country specifically for sex; authorities say that as many as 90 percent of Spain's prostitutes may be victims of human trafficking.

byline.contributor: Rachel Chaundler and Stefania Rousselle contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: While the rest of Spain’s economy struggles, prostitution — almost all of it involving the ruthless trafficking of foreign women — is exploding into public view.

headline.seo: Women Enslaved by Spain’s Brothel Tourism Boom
headline.main: In Spain, Women Enslaved by a Boom in Brothel Tourism
headline.print_headline: In Spain, Enslaved by a Boom in Brothel Tourism
